event.name: DUSK_PLANNERS
event.text: It's unusual to see non-military Rebel vessels outside of safezones, but an Auto-escort is leading the way for a party of Rebel architects who seem to be preparing something at the nearby system.
The Rebels seem fairly annoyed by your pestering. "We're busy, idiot! Trying to build a new residential zone somewhere nearby. Don't you have orphans to murder somewhere?"

choice.text: Isn't this sector controlled by Duskbringers though?

event.text: "Well yeah, right NOW it is. But Universe 1'll plow through them soon enough. We were sent ahead of time to prepare for the inevitable surge in population once we wrench this place out of the hands of those hardlight freaks. Ex-warzones are all the rage nowadays."

choice.text: (Duskbringer Crew) Trick them into heading straight into the Dusk fleet.

event.text: With some smooth talking (and failing to mention the source of the information) you convince the Rebels to head in the direction of a supposed Duskbringer outpost. This should delay the Rebels for a bit...

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Convince them you've also been sent by the Rebels.

event.text: "Universe 1 hires Renegades now? Since when? I know Vance ain't always the most rational guy but... really? Well, not my place to complain. If you're travelling through here you'll need to be extra cautious you don't step into a trap. Here's some flight plans, hopefully it helps."

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Recommend them a good spot.

event.text: They might be skeptical at first, but after looking over the map plans the Rebels seem to realize you've given them quite the prime location. "Well I'll be, I guess Renegades are useful for more than just kicking puppies after all. Hah! Eh whatever, I'll pay you if it keeps you from making a flesh suit out of me."

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Recommend them a good spot.

"Well I'll be, I guess Renegades are useful for more than just kicking puppies after all. Hah! Eh whatever, I'll pay you if it keeps you from making a flesh suit out of me."
As soon as you open fire, the escort locks onto your hull and the Rebels jump away, leaving you alone to fight the drone.
They might not be military, but that doesn't mean these Rebels are any safer to mess with. Better to leave them alone.

event.name: DUSK_MILITIA_ESCORT
event.text: Friends of the Federation aren't all that common in these parts, but a Militia transport protected by an escort is passing through. They must have noticed you, but they don't attempt to make contact.
It appears that the transport has sustained some damage, and judging from the nature of the damage it appears to have been Energy Cannons, meaning they were most likely attacked by the Duskbringers.

choice.text: Offer some scrap to help repair.

event.text: The Militiamen are surprised by your offer, but they graciously accept.
They offer you a gift as thanks for your generous donation.
The escort isn't about to let you get away with your attack. The transport is unable to fight back and watches the battle in despair.

choice.text: (Repair Drone) Offer to use the drone to fix up their ship.

choice.text: (Repair Cluster) Offer to use the bomb to fix up their ship.

choice.text: (Repair Arm) Offer to use the arm to fix up their hull.

event.name: DUSK_MILITIA_ESCORT_SURRENDER
event.text: The Militia escort can't escape without leaving the transport unprotected. Instead, they opt to surrender, pleading for you to let them live.

You decide to pull back from your assault. The envoy is left almost completely destroyed, and most likely won't be able to repair the transport in time to save both of them before the Duskbringers arrive. Still, they hand over a weapon from the transport's cargo as "thanks" for "sparing" them.

event.name: DUSK_MILITIA_ESCORT_DESTROY
event.text: The escort is destroyed, leaving the transport unprotected. They have nowhere to run, and are completely at your mercy.

choice.text: Destroy the transport and salvage the wreck.

event.text: The militiamen aboard the transport plead for you to spare them, but you end transmissions and destroy their ship. It explodes much more violently than expected, the shockwave throwing back your ship and sending debris scattering across the hull. You don't know what the ship was carrying, but it must have been something explosive. You're certain the rest of the cargo is destroyed, but there still remains some wreckage to salvage.

choice.text: Demand the transport transfer their cargo.

event.text: The militiamen hurry to meet your demands. It appears their ship was carrying high grade explosives and ballistic weaponry, of which you now hold ownership over. You leave them to their certain demise.

event.name: DUSK_SLAVER_TRADE
event.text: Not too long after you jump to this beacon, a slaver also jumps nearby. They hail you. "Interesting, a Renegade. Ain't a common sight down here. Don't suppose you need some crew?"
"Shame, I was hoping you might be different... Men, arm the guns!"
"Yes yes, to be expected. Have fun dealing with the Duskys!" They jump away, and a Duskbringer ship jumps in almost immediately after. The slavers must have been followed!
Before you can express your interest, a Duskbringer hot in pursuit of the slaver ship jumps in and destroys the pirates. They waste no time moving in to destroy you as well!
"Now THAT sure is an unexpected sight. Come aboard captain, see if there's anything that... piques your interests."

event.name: DUSK_SLAVER_TRADE_BUY_2
event.text: The inside of the slaver ship is no pretty sight. All around various aliens are chained to the walls, many of which have sickening bruises or scars all over their bodies. To turn against the slavers now would be a death sentence, so you better buy someone or get out.

"Excellent choice!" The pirates unchain the slave and toss them in your direction. You bring them back to your ship before telling them that they've been liberated. Perhaps the Duskbringers aren't as bad as the pirates after all...

"Excellent choice!" The pirates unchain the slave and toss them in your direction. You bring them back to your ship before telling them that they've been liberated. Perhaps the Duskbringers aren't as bad as the pirates after all...

"Excellent choice!" The pirates unchain the slave and toss them in your direction. You bring them back to your ship before telling them that they've been liberated. Perhaps the Duskbringers aren't as bad as the pirates after all...
"Ah what a shame. If you ever need some extra hands, you can always find us again!" You quickly leave before they can consider taking you captive as well.

event.name: DUSK_PROPAGANDA
event.text: A massive machine floats nearby, akin to a station in size, but appears to be fully automated and Zoltan made. As soon as lies start flooding in through your radio, it becomes clear that this is some sort of automated propaganda broadcaster. "Federation officers eat BABIES! That's a fact! Think of the children. Join the Duskbringers today and make the monsters pay!"
The Duskbringers and their fascist lies can go to hell. You take apart the power source for the machine and strip apart its outer hull.

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Reprogram the machine to spread lies about your location.

event.text: The Rebels and Duskbringers have worked together on occasion but wouldn't normally take advice from propaganda like this. Still - the location of your ship is information they wouldn't want to pass up and they wouldn't expect the Duskbringers to have any reason to lie.

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Reprogram the machine to spread lies about your location.

choice.text: (Hacking Weapon) Scramble its defenses and upload a message to lie about your location.

event.name: DUSK_IDOL
event.text: You receive a hail from a young Duskbringer soldier. At first you assume he has some sort of threat for you, but instead he seems amazed to be meeting a Multiverse traveler in person. "Woah, you're one of those special timey wimey ships!"

"Wow! Oooh ooh, have you ever been to Earth?! There was this guy... oh here's a picture!" He holds up a small, black and white photograph of a man saluting to a crowd of people. "He's like a hero of mine! I don't know how to say his name in human language, but he was like a famous leader and he almost conquered the world or something! Have you ever met him?"

choice.text: Tell the truth and say you haven't.

event.text: "You haven't? Man... Well, fun chat! Best I kill you now."

choice.text: (Human Crew) Your human knows who it is.

event.text: Your human coughs, and briefly explains that the man in the photo was no hero, and most of the people of Old Earth resented him for years after he died. "O-oh. I assumed he must have been a famous human warrior! I guess in a sense I was right... but not like that. You know so much more than I do! Oh, command will be so mad at me... but I can't pass up this opportunity!"
"Really?! That's amazing! I wish to come with you, I cannot let this opportunity be passed up to meet actual Renegades!"

You quickly regret your decision when the Duskbringer asks a series of questions about the man that you have no idea how to answer. Eventually he starts to see through your ruse and orders the ship to attack!

event.name: DUSK_MFKHELP
event.text: A nearby Zoltan city on the nearest planet's surface appears to have been damaged heavily from some kind of recent attack. An MFK vessel is parked in orbit, observing the city from a safe distance. You can't quite ascertain what its intentions are.

At first, the MFK's won't receive your hails. Finally, after enough repeated pestering, they pick up. "Yes, I hear you. God damn it, do you have anything better to do than harass us? What do you want?!"

"Responsible? No, we were sent to clean up this mess. Universe 1's gotten too big for its britches and thinks it can decide how the local Rebellions should run their politics! Well damn that to hell, we fought a Civil War too! The one mistake the Rebellion made back in the day, was thinking that just because humans are superior we couldn't cooperate with other races. Just look at these Zoltans. They get the idea. Sure, we have some... ideological incompatibilities, but we can both agree different species are better off unified and separate. But the collective egos of Universe 1 have gone too far, and now they think they can just wipe the Duskbringers out entirely! Screw that and screw them, not if I have my say. We're helping locate survivors and escort them to medical facilities. If you want to be useful, you could try helping."

choice.text: Assist in locating the survivors - though it'll take some time.

event.text: You send a team down the city and navigate through the ruins. You find several survivors, but less than a dozen. It's a pitiful haul, but the Rebels have a similar turnout of their own. "Damn it! Damn it, damn it, damn it!" The MFK stomps his foot on the ground and clenches his fists. "Look at this, all of this pointless destruction. Going after civilians? Is this what we've come to? This city didn't even have a military installation, it was a trading port! Back in the Civil War the fleet was purely occupational, we held the territory but let people go on with business. Now, it has become a ravaging death omen, burning down cities and killing any poor vessel caught in its wake." He takes a deep breath and tries to recollect his emotions. "Regardless, thank you for your collaboration. We'll move these people to the nearest medical facility and come back to search later. I'll have my men give you something on your way out."

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Assist in locating the survivors.
(Telepathic Shell) Assist in locating the survivors.
(Lifeform Scanner) Assist in locating the survivors.
(Adv. Sensors) Assist in locating the survivors.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Assist in locating the survivors.

event.text: "Damn Renegade scum, always getting in the way! You're no heroes or glorious crusaders of justice, you're just pests devoid of morals!"
"Who do you think you are? The Rebellion won't take those words from anyone, let alone Renegade scum like you!"
The MFK hangs up and mutes your communications. When you continue to try and hail them, the ship flies to the other side of the city.
"God damn Renegades, making life hell for anyone that dares enter their line of sight. We'll be making the whole Multiverse safer without you around!"

choice.text: Ignore the city and the ship.

event.text: Better not to risk getting too close to an MFK.

event.name: DUSK_MFKHELP_GOOD
event.text:
With the help of your scanners, you find several dozen survivors and quickly. It's surely not all of them, but it's a lot, more than double what the Rebels manage. "God, you're dedicated. Maybe I thought wrongly of Renegades. Maybe you are crusaders of justice... or at least not the emotionless assassins I thought."
The MFK turns to survey the ruins. "All of this damage was unnecessary, utterly pointless. What are they thinking, going after civilians? There was no military installation here, it was a trading port! Our once purely occupational fleet has become a ravaging death omen, burning down cities and killing any poor vessel caught in its wake. None of this has to do with the cause. It's aimless destruction wrought by egotistical madmen. Or... a psychopathic AI. We never should have built that thing. The C.I.C.A. project was a mistake, all it's done is coerce Vance to more and more brutal methods."
The MFK takes a deep sigh. "Frankly, I'm rooting for you to blow that damn Flagship to smithereens. As much as I hate the Federation, I prefer a corrupt and aimless bureaucracy over a perfected and infinite death machine. I'll see to it my men give you something for your trouble on your way out."

event.name: DUSK_DNA
event.text: On the distant but visibly populated planet you can make out some kind of massive Duskbringer structure, heavily fortified and partially concealed by a forest. Scans show large amounts of power being drawn into the facility.

You pilot down to the surface, making sure you aren't spotted, and hide in a thick patch of trees. Your crew continue on foot until they reach the entrance of the structure, protected by 2 heavily armed Duskbringer soldiers.

choice.text: (Monk Crew) Have your monk stun the guards.
(Duskbringer Crew) Talk your way past the guards.
You aren't going anywhere near a Duskbringer facility on your own.

event.text: You're on no suicide mission, and dropping by a Duskbringer megastructure isn't on your to-do list. You fly past the planet.

You underestimate the Duskbringer guards, thinking you can quickly take them out. However, they're quick to the draw and one of your crew falls to the ground, injured. Fortunately, you're able to silently subdue them before anyone else can get hurt.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crew is revived back at the ship and hurries back to meet up with you.

event.text: Your crew manage to subdue the Duskbringer soldiers silently. You proceed into the building...
This may go down as the quickest reconsideration in Federation history, but it's better safe than sorry.
You order the crew back to the ship, only to find a Duskbringer patrol ship surveying it! Looks like you'll have to take care of these guys before you can leave.

event.name: DUSK_DNA_INSIDE
event.text: You proceed into the facility, and are surprised to find rows and rows of what appear to be... test tubes? Each has a small digital label on it denoting them to different serial numbers.

It takes some time looking through the machinery to realize this must be some sort of massive DNA bank! You could likely dismantle some of this tech and bring it back with you, or quickly try to clone one of the Duskbringer soldiers and convince them to work for you.

choice.text: Grab the Cloning tech. [Install a Clone Bay, grants Backup DNA]

event.text: You dismantle some of the cloning tech and bring it back to the ship.

choice.text: Grab the Cloning tech. [Backup DNA and 1 free cloning upgrade]

event.text: You dismantle some of the cloning tech and bring it back to the ship.

You quickly grab a random vial for a Duskbringer Martyr and make sure to wipe all personal memories but not skills or training. Once your new crew is birthed from the machine, utterly confused on their whereabouts, you inform them about the Federation that they now serve and prepare to leave.

event.name: DUSK_DNA_FIGHT
event.text: As you leave the facility, an elite Duskbringer vessel approaches you, and an alarm sounds. Looks like you weren't as unnoticed as you thought!

event.name: NEBULA_DUSK_INFILTRATION
event.text: Despite the ion storm here, you manage to just barely make out the hull of another ship in the clouds. As you move closer, you realize this is an elite Duskbringer station! Before you can consider your options, you receive a hail from a cloaked ship not too far away.

The cloaked ship appears to be a Coalition vessel, led by a tough looking Leech Ampere. It's not too often you see a ship like this, especially so far out, so they immediately catch your attention. "Look, let's cut to the chase. We don't like each other, and we stand for different things. But I think there's at least one thing we can agree on. Duskbringers are the worst. A while ago, there was an effort to get them to consider joining the Coalition - this should technically be classified, but it was such a stupid idea I don't care. Those fascist pricks told us they'd sooner resign to being a species of toilet-cleaners than join our 'dysfunctional pseudo-Federation'. We've been sent on a covert operation to infiltrate this station and steal some tech the Coalition had been hoping to gain in a trade deal. If you help us, I'll uh... uhm..."

"Sorry, I'm just not used to talking for this long to a Renegade and not being shot at. And also I'm trying really hard not to start insulting you. It's like, a thing I've been seeing a counselor for. Anyways, maybe I'll let you in on some of the tech, but you can't tell anyone. Coalition command would be on my ass tighter than a Leech on an... ass. All we have to do is clean out the Zoltan 'infestation' and take the station. And yes I know I said this was covert. This is what the Slugs on the Coalition council call covert, so be quiet."

"Perfect. Though, perhaps I should ask... are you better with the 'clearing things out' side of this? Either my crew could board while you provide fire support until we're done, or you can send your crew in while we assist."

The Ampere nods and cuts comms. Both of your ships reveal themselves and engage the station, which returns fire. While you clear out the crew of the Duskbringer ship, the Coalition ship will provide fire support.

The Ampere nods and cuts comms. Both of your ships reveal themselves and engage the station, which returns fire. You just need to hold the station off without destroying it until the Coalition team finishes their mission!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Time until the Coalition ship has finished their infiltration.

choice.text: We aren't working with the Coalition.

event.text: The Leech grumbles something about the 'typical' but says nothing more on the matter. Their ship cloaks again and flies away shortly after.

event.name: DUSK_INFILTRATION_SUCCESS
event.text: Suddenly, the station falls silent, and you receive a hail from the Coalition. "Great work, the first part of the job is done. Go ahead and dock, and we'll search for the tech."

event.name: DUSK_INFILTRATION_SEARCH
event.text: Both your crew and the Coalition crew search through the station's interior, turning over shelves and emptying boxes. You're not actually sure what you're looking for, but you just assume you'll know it when you see it. Eventually you come across a room marked "lab", and this discovery seems to excite the Coalition as much as yourself.

You pull open the laboratory door - only for an explosive device inside to trigger. The lab is decimated, and there's no hope of putting the fire out. You retreat back to your ships, still coughing from the smoke. "Shit, shit, shit! There's no doubt they rigged that during the fight to screw us all over! The tech is destroyed - the Coalition is going to have my ass for this! I-I'll be chopped into bits and made an example of! I can't go back - you have to take me with you! I can be useful, I swear."

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Scan the interior of the lab.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Scan the interior of the lab.
(Slug Crew) Sense for a trap inside the lab.
(Telepathic Shell) Sense for a trap inside the lab.

event.name: DUSK_INFILTRATION_LAB
event.text: Your more thorough search reveals the Duskbringers have wired an explosive device inside the lab, which is set to go off if the door is opened. To make your way in will require a lot of finesse - otherwise you'll have to break the bad news to the Coalition.

Upon hearing this news, the Ampere falls into panic. "Shit, shit, shit! There's no doubt they rigged that during the fight to screw us all over! If we return with nothing, the Coalition is going to have my ass for this! I-I'll be chopped into bits and made an example of! I can't go back - you have to take me with you! I can be useful, I swear."

event.name: DUSK_INFILTRATION_TECH
event.text: Your crew manage to disarm the bomb and open the lab. You find all sorts of strange cybernetics forged from concentrated Aether, one of the most valuable and rare known materials in the Multiverse. How the Duskbringers got their hands on this is a mystery, but you're glad to have your share of it now. The Coalition shows their gratitude, albeit they're a bit distracted. "I won't be executed after all... and to think this stupid suicide mission was all a punishment for deserting from Project Ember." The Leech glances over at you. "Er... forget that last part. But a deal is a deal. We'll split the tech."

event.name: NEBULA_DUSK_PRISONERS
event.text: A small moon is orbiting an otherwise uninhabited rogue planet drifting within the nebula. After running some scans, you suspect the presence of a large high-security prison for POWs. Knowing the Duskbringers, it likely contains a lot of Federation and Ministry personnel, and maybe even some captives from the U1 fleet.

choice.text: Attack and break out the prisoners!
(Cloaking) Cloak and send the crew inside undetected.

event.text: Tempting as it is, there's no way you could pull something like that off. You leave the prison behind.
You attempt to break into the prison, but things don't go as planned. A defense system blasts a hole in your ship and soldiers beam aboard before you can pull away!
It's risky, but you manage to brute force your way past the security and make it inside the building.

event.name: DUSK_PRISONERS_SUCCESS
event.text: Your attempts inside are successful. As expected, there are several prison cells holding a wide variety of prisoners, including Federation soldiers, Rebel officers, Ministry personnel, and even some Engi and a group of Theocracy monks! You'll only have so long until the guards catch you, but you might be able to break a couple of these guys out.

choice.text: Save one of the Ministry peacekeepers.

event.text: The Zoltan is grateful for your assistance. "These fascists risk to ruin the very foundations of any relations the Federation and the Ministry might have left. We cannot let them succeed!" You break open the cage and free them, but an alarm blares, and you can hear Duskbringers marching towards your location. There's no time for introductions, you have to get out of here fast!

choice.text: Save one of the Federation medics.

event.text: The Human is grateful for your assistance. "I was aboard a humanitarian transport onroute to a warzone when the Duskbringers requisitioned our vessel. I expected them to honor our presence, but I guess the Duskbringers make no exceptions." You break open the cage and free the prisoner inside, but an alarm blares, and you can hear Duskbringers marching towards your location. There's no time for introductions, you have to get out of here fast!

choice.text: Save one of the Theocracy crusaders.

event.text: The Rockman is grateful for your assistance. "I was tasked with protecting a missionary vessel, and we mistakenly passed through a Duskbringer sector thinking it was still Ministry occupied. Damn these Zoltans, no holy quest is worth their salvation." You break open the cage and free the prisoner inside, but an alarm blares, and you can hear Duskbringers marching towards your location. There's no time for introductions, you have to get out of here fast!

event.name: DUSK_PRISONERS_LEAVE
event.text: As you're leaving the prison behind, a Dusk ship swoops in. It's an elite Jailer, and they aren't pleased. Prepare for combat!

event.name: DUSK_YOUNG
event.text: A very young Duskbringer, perhaps not even yet an adult, is barreling down towards you. "Federation pig! This here is Zoltan space, and you ain't welcome here! You're in for it now, for I am here! I will be your downfall! I eat Feds and Renegades for breakfast, yeah? Just like my hero, Devorak the Deathless! I'm climbing the ranks, yeah? I'm gonna be the greatest, most loyal, most deadliest Duskbringer there ever was, yeah? Aren't you quaking in your boots, yeah?"

choice.text: Aren't you a bit young to be a soldier?

event.text: The Zoltan spits on the ground. "Ain't you listening pig? I ain't a soldier. I'm a freakin' Duskbringer, yeah? The greatest Duskbringer! Killing Renegades like they ain't nothin'. Cause they ain't! I'm a real freakin' hero, everybody loves me, yeah? Now start quaking, pig!"

choice.text: Doesn't that make you a soldier?

event.text: "What? Pfft, shows how much you know, pig! A soldier's nothin' but a brainwashed lackey, who eats hay and dies for a cause he ain't even knowing! A Duskbringer's a glorious warrior of the future, bringin' about the destiny of the Zoltan race, yeah? What'd you know about a glorious future, pig? Enough talkin' now, yeah? I'm gonna show you what a glorious future really means!"
"Yeah, quake like that! Shake like the little baby you are, yeah? Hahah! You Renegades are a bunch of cowards! I feel pity for you now, pig. Here, take some pity scrap, why don't ya? Hah!"
"Good, good! Now get out of here before I change my mind and kill you, pig!" You can sense a sort of relief in the Zoltan's voice, as if he's glad he doesn't really have to fight you.
"Oh well you're in for it now, pig! Get ready to face your end!"
No point in wasting time with this. You arm the weapons and get ready to fight.

"At ease." Devorak says, gently. "You don't need to impress anyone."
"Devorak??" The Duskbringer sounds surprised, his cocky voice becoming one of reverence. "What are you doing aboard a Renegade ship?"
"You don't have to push yourself. You have your whole life ahead of you. You and your friends should go and live life... you shouldn't fight unless you know what you're fighting for. And more importantly, what you're fighting against."
The kid nods, the wind taken out of his sails. For a moment he looks like he wants to come join you, but Devorak shakes his head. Instead, his crew surrender their cargo, including a weapon.

event.name: DUSK_YOUNG_SURRENDER
event.text: "Alright pig, well played, well played! Made a mess of my ship, yeah? Bet you're real proud of yourself, yeah? Well give yourself a pat on the back, sure! Beat the deadliest Duskbringer around, yeah? There'll be more comin' for you after this, let me tell you! But 'cause you proved yourself, I'll take pity on you!"
"Yeah, smart one you are! Next time think before you wander into Zoltan space, you hear? No room for pigs here, yeah?!"

"You ain't gonna take nothin'? You're just letting me go, pig? What kind of nonsense is this? You're a murderer, an assassin. And I'm a big target, yeah? If you ain't takin' my money, then you sparing me?"

choice.text: You're not a Duskbringer or a soldier. You're just a kid.

event.text: "I ain't a kid, pig! I'm a Duskbringer! A cold blooded, green skinned, Zoltan-loving Duskbringer damn it! How dare you insult the deadliest Duskbringer around!" Despite the tough talk, the Zoltan makes no move to actually resume contact. "Well, you'll pay for it another time then, yeah? But not right now... I have to rest. Did a number on me pig. If the Rebels come around, I'll tell them you went the other way, yeah? Don't think it's a favor pig, it just serves my purposes well."

choice.text: Flatter him - You're too high a target and I don't want the Duskbringers after us.

event.text: "Ahhh, so the truth comes out, yeah? Wise one you are! Got my respect now, you do! Don't worry about nothin' pig, I got your back! Us smart ones gotta stick together, I'll keep them Duskbringers from being too harsh on you, yeah?"

event.name: DUSK_SNEAKYREBEL
event.text: At first the beacon appears to be desolate, until a glimmer of blue catches your eye in the distance. Looks like it's an MV Rebel ship trying to avoid being detected.

The Rebel captain is startled to see you. "A Renegade? Damn it, we were hoping to go unspotted... Please, hear us out! We're not from Universe 1. Not all of us support those genocidal reality-hoppers. I joined the Rebellion during the Civil War because I thought Vance would finally bring lasting peace to the galaxy - but this? This is just too far. We're on our way to deliver supplies to a Duskbringer outpost in the sector. We could spare some of the supplies if that'll satiate you."

choice.text: Ex-Rebel or not, we aren't letting any supplies get into the hands of the Duskbringers!

event.text: You arm the guns and prepare to fight.
The Rebel captain tries to protest when you power up the weapons but it's too late. You're already locked on and firing!
It's a bad idea to go following Rebels in such dangerous territory.
Your attempt to follow the Rebels is unsuccessful. You're easily spotted, and the ship immediately jumps away.

event.name: DUSK_SNEAKYREBEL_FOLLOW_GOOD
event.text: You tail the ship for a while until you eventually spot a Duskbringer outpost in the distance. You start to wonder if the ship has come to ambush the Duskbringers when it, to your surprise, docks and begins to offload cargo! You tap into the comms to hear what's happening on board. "It wasn't easy getting this ship. I had to go against orders on all sorts of levels, but Universe 1 can... do something unsavory to my reproductive organs." Seems they're actually part of the local Rebellion, still trying to aid the Duskbringers.

choice.text: Wait behind and try to steal some supplies.

event.text: Not too long later the Rebel ship undocks and jumps away, giving you time to try and steal some supplies. Unfortunately, the Duskbringers were more prepared than you thought, and try to defend themselves!

event.name: DUSK_HARASS
event.text: A Monk convoy being escorted by a badly damaged Ministry vessel has been stopped nearby by a Duskbringer patrol ship. Based on intercepted comm frequencies, it seems the Duskbringers are using the presence of a Ministry ship as a chance to harass the monks.
"Renegade filth? In our sector? What business do YOU have with protecting monks all of a sudden?" The Duskbringer ship raises its defenses and prepares to defend itself.

choice.text: Threaten the Duskbringers into standing down.

event.text: Your crewmember is livid with the actions of their former colleagues. "Our goal is the rightful glorification of Zoltan-kind! What good is that mission if we so easily lash out against our fellow Zoltans, even ones who may not follow the words of Solay?" The other Duskbringers bow their heads in shame and return to their ship without any bloodshed.
It's not your duty to go protecting some monks.

The Duskbringers aren't having any of your threats. "In case you didn't notice, Renegade, this is OUR territory, and we decide who gets to come and go here! No one threatens the Duskbringers, especially not in our space!"
Startled to see they've been caught, the Duskbringers immediately surrender, forking over some paltry bribe before jumping away.

The monks are so terrified, that they're talking too fast for your translator to even pick up what they're saying. Fortunately, one of the Peacekeepers that was escorting them is holding together slightly more and offers you a reward for saving them.

It seems something malfunctioned in the Life Support of the escort ship, suffocating the entirety of the crew. Left unprotected, the monks have nowhere else to go and beg you to let them come with you.

event.name: DUSK_TEAMUP
event.text: You hardly have time to recollect yourself after the light speed jump because the area around this beacon is in total chaos. A Duskbringer, Elite Rebel, Rock, and Zoltan ship are in the midst of a dogfight.
Shots come in from all sides as you join the chaotic brawl, heading straight for the Rebels.
Shots come in from all sides as you join the chaotic brawl, heading straight for the Duskbringers.
Shots come in from all sides as you join the chaotic brawl, heading straight for the Zoltans.
Shots come in from all sides as you join the chaotic brawl, heading straight for the Rockmen.

choice.text: Get the hell out of here.

event.text: You jump away as fast as possible. You catch the Rockmen yelling "Cowards!" over your comms, but eventually you're far away enough that they can't reach you.

event.name: DUSK_TEAMUP_REBEL
event.text: As you stand victorious over the defeated Rebel ship, the other ships cease their attack. The Duskbringer escapes while it still can, but the Zoltan and Rock ships thank you. The Zoltan works to repair your hull while the Rock gifts you some ammunition.

event.name: DUSK_TEAMUP_DUSK
event.text: The Dusk ship is destroyed, leaving the Rebel without an ally. Despite being better equipped than any of your ships individually, they are no match against the three of you. They surrender and jump away. The Zoltans and Rockmen thank you for your help, and work together to repair your hull.

event.name: DUSK_TEAMUP_ZOLTAN
event.text: You have defeated the Zoltans, leaving the Rockmen without an ally. They abandon all hope and take a kamikaze run straight into the Duskbringer ship, destroying both almost instantly. The last survivor, the Rebel ship, hails you. "Alright, now this is interesting. I suppose I should report your locations to my fleet, but truth be told I don't think I woulda made it outta that one without your help. Tell you what, I'm gonna tell the Fleet your location alright, but it won't be very accurate. In fact, it'll probably lead 'em in circles for a few jumps." You're surprised at the Rebel's willingness to help, but gladly accept it.

event.name: DUSK_TEAMUP_ROCK
event.text: The Rock ship explodes, whether it was from the damage caused in the fight or a last ditch suicide attempt. Your ship is unharmed but a portion of the debris is sent flying into the Zoltan, crippling their shields. The Duskbringer quickly dispatches the ship. You're now outnumbered, and suspect the worst, but the other two ships make no move to attack. The Duskbringer jumps away, unninterested in salvaging any of the wrecks. The Rebel hails you. "Alright, now this is interesting. I suppose I should report your locations to my fleet, but truth be told I don't think I woulda made it outta that one without your help. Tell you what, I'm gonna tell the Fleet your location alright, but it won't be very accurate. In fact, it'll probably lead 'em in circles for a few jumps." You're surprised at the Rebel's willingness to help, but gladly accept it.

event.name: DUSK_PIRATES_HIDING
event.text: A group of pirates has taken refuge from the seemingly endless Duskbringer patrols in the shadow of a small moon. You doubt they can see you.
The pirates don't move from their hiding place. You figure it's safe to do something else, but keep an eye on them just in case.

The rest of the pirates flee, scattering away in different directions as soon as they spot you, but one particularly irate pirate hails you. "A Fed? Get lost! It's hard enough survivin' out here with them explosive nazi freaks, I don't need to deal with you too!"
Surpisingly, none of the pirates move as you approach. One hails you, demanding to know your intentions.
Most of the pirates flee, not wanting to take on a full sized cruiser. One however stays behind, confident in their ability to destroy you.

The pirates whisper amongst each other. You wait for a while and begin to consider leaving before the one who you assume is their leader speaks up. "Alright, we have thought long and hard about it. A little trade doesn't hurt, but the minute we suspect you of anything shifty, we'll blow you to smithereens." You consider it ironic for this to be coming from pirates, but you agree to their terms.

event.name: DUSK_IDIOT
event.text: A Duskbringer ship nearby hails you. A scrawny Zoltan appears, though he is facing the wrong way. He realizes his mistake and turns around, but he's already come across as an idiot. "Federation ships are not welcome here! You are violating protocol... uh... well you're violating one of them. You are a Federation ship, right?"
"Great! This is my chance to prove myself after my last mistake! Devorak will be so happy!" He powers up his weapons and attacks.
"Oh, my bad sir. Have a wonderful day!" He ends comms, and jumps away. You suspect there might be some sort of trick, but nothing happens. What a moron.

At the sight of Devorak, the Duskbringer starts to stammer. "D-D-D-Devorak! You... you saw that?" Devorak sighs, nodding his head. The embarrassed Duskbringer covers his face. "Just my luck... one of the dozen times I screw up this week happens to be in front of the big cheese..."
"Soldier, you seem out of your element. If you're struggling, then maybe there's something better you could be doing. Is there anything you enjoy?"
"Well I uh... I sorta enjoy baking... But every time I blow up I feel like I get a little worse at it, so I haven't done it in a while."
"Then stop dying for the cause. Live, and do what you like doing." With tears in his eyes, the Duskbringer nods. His ship gives their idol a gift of scrap.

event.name: DUSK_JAILER_CHOICE
event.text: The Duskbringers are no fans of intruders in their territory, and so it is not uncommon to see Jailer vessels patrolling the area to transport prisoners. One such ship has made a quick pit-stop here and is re-calibrating their sensors.
You move in to destroy the Jailer, knowing that you'll have to kill their crew if you want the prisoners to live.

Your crew, armed to the teeth, board the Jailer and quickly take down the Duskbringer crew staffing it. With the jailers turned prisoners, you free everyone locked up who you don't think will kill you immediately.
The Jailer doesn't seem to notice as you slip away.

event.name: DUSK_JAILER_KILL
event.text: You've destroyed the Jailer, but unfortunately none of the captives survived the explosion. You scrap the remains and try to avoid the drifting corpses.

event.name: DUSK_JAILER_CAPTURE
event.text: The Jailer's crew is dead but most of the captives survived the fight. Most of them request to be dropped off as soon as you're out of the stronghold, but one volunteers to stay behind and work aboard your ship.

event.name: DISTRESS_DUSK_MONASTERY
event.text: Though Illesctrian Monasteries are usually constructed on the surface of planets, some, like the one at this beacon broadcasting the distress signal, are built on large space stations. Unfortunately, this makes them prime targets for hostiles. A pirate group has taken the monastery hostage, and a Duskbringer squadron is trying to negotiate their release.

choice.text: Help the pirates keep control of the station and fight back the Duskbringers.

event.text: Your intervention appears to spark chaos, and soon both pirates and Duskbringers are swarming at each other. You take on the nearest ship.

choice.text: Help the Duskbringers retake the Monastery from the pirates.

event.text: You swoop into the scene, weapons blasting at the nearest pirate ship. The Duskbringers are confused but realize there's no option but to fight, and soon both sides are engulfed in combat.
No need to get involved in things like this, especially when neither side is your friend. You slip away unnoticed.

event.name: DUSK_MONASTERY_PIRATE_WIN
event.text: The presumed leader of the pirates hails you. "Hah! That was one hell of a performance. You have my thanks and my respects, captain. So, waddya want?"

"What? You gotta be kidding me. How're we gonna make a profit then?" You propose to them that they could sell the holy artifacts on the black market. "Yeah... alright. Shoulda known you'd go with the sissy option. I'll let the freakos go." The pirates release the monks. With nowhere for them to go, you offer to drop them off at the next holy place you encounter. Most agree, but one of the younger monks requests to join your crew.

choice.text: We want some of the monk's valuables.

event.text: "Yeah, alright. We're gonna keep them religious freakos hostage anyways, negotiate a real hell ova bounty from their government. Have at the spoils of their treasury."

event.name: DUSK_MONASTERY_DUSK_WIN
event.text: When no Duskbringers attempt to hail you, you reach out to their leader. "Yes... yes. You've made quite the show of dominance, and I don't suppose it was out of kindness. What do you want?"

choice.text: Give the Rebels fake information on our location.

event.text: "I'm going to be martyred because of this..." Though he's clearly unhappy with your request, the Duskbringer accepts. You can only hope he will really give lies, and not just rat you out.
"Yes, I suppose you do. Don't we all... I was hoping to kill a Fed with this gun, not gift it to one." He reluctantly passes over one of his weapons and some ammunition.

event.name: DISTRESS_DUSK_DAMAGEDFLEET
event.text: The distress beacon here is coming from no ordinary ship. In the distance lies an immense Zoltan fleetship, a Dreadnaught from the looks of it. It has received critical damage, and a good portion of the ship is completely depressurized.

The Zoltan captain urgently welcomes you inside the ship's spacious hangar. "Good, reinforcements have arrived. The Zoltan Minister dispatched a few small fleets to the Duskbringer sectors to make sure they were kept under control. We hadn't realized how strong they had grown, and they destroyed our fleet with alarming efficiency. We're the only ship left, and that won't last long if we don't make repairs. Our medical and life support systems were damaged heavily but not completely destroyed. There's still hope to fix them, but the path to get to them is completely oxygenless and possibly still has hostiles roaming around."

choice.text: Send some crew to repair the life support.
There's no crew available to perform repairs.
(Anaerobic Crew) Send your crew to repair the life support.

event.text: Without a need for oxygen, your crew doesn't struggle at all with repairing the systems. Once the oxygen levels are stable enough, the remaining Zoltan crew seek out any Duskbringers who may be onboard and dispose of them. Once all is clear the Zoltan captain thanks you for your assistance and pays you a large reward.

choice.text: (Osmian Crew) Send a hologram to repair the life support.

event.text: Without a need for oxygen, your crew's hologram doesn't struggle at all with repairing the systems. Once the oxygen levels are stable enough, the remaining Zoltan crew seek out any Duskbringers who may be onboard and dispose of them. Once all is clear the Zoltan captain thanks you for your assistance and pays you a large reward.

choice.text: (Repair Drone) Send your drone to repair the life support.

event.text: Without a need for oxygen, your drone doesn't struggle at all with repairing the systems. Once the oxygen levels are stable enough, the remaining Zoltan crew seek out any Duskbringers who may be onboard and dispose of them. Once all is clear the Zoltan captain thanks you for your assistance and pays you a large reward.

choice.text: We can't help with repairs, but we can take as many crew as possible in our cargo.

event.text: "It's a less than optimal option, but it may be our only choice." The Zoltans hurry onboard. Most are dropped off at the nearby station, but the captain stays behind. "You've done us a great service today, and it would be a shame not to repay it. I have failed my duty in this sector, but perhaps I can help you achieve yours."
A ship of such size doesn't come to hostile territory such as this without being accompanied by at least a small fleet. Reinforcements will likely arrive soon.

Your team returns, happy to report their mission was a success. Once the oxygen levels are stable enough, the remaining Zoltan crew seek out any Duskbringers who may be onboard and dispose of them. Once all is clear the Zoltan captain thanks you for your assistance and pays you a large reward.

Most of your crew return unharmed, but one did not make it. They report that they ran into Duskbringers on the way and were caught in a firefight. You apologize to the Zoltans for your failure, but there's nothing else you can do.

removeCrew.text: Luckily your crewmember was able to be cloned.

event.name: DISTRESS_DUSK_FEDERATION
event.text: A marooned Federation ship with a nasty hole in their engines appears to be the source of the distress beacon. "Oh, thank god someone came. We were afraid help would never arrive before a Duskbringer patrol alerted the fleet of our position. Please, can you do something about the damage, or lend some fuel? We're leaking fuel badly, but if we have just a little bit, we might be able to make it to a store."
"Thank you, captain. Hopefully it won't all leak out before we get there."
"Here, have this as thanks. We were going to sell this to buy more fuel anyways."

choice.text: (Repair Drone) Use the drone to repair their engines.

event.text: The drone works perfectly, sealing up the breach.
"Here, have this as thanks. We were going to sell this to buy more fuel anyways."

choice.text: (Repair Cluster) Use the bomb to repair their engines.

event.text: The bomb works perfectly, sealing up the breach.
"Here, have this as thanks. We were going to sell this to buy more fuel anyways."

choice.text: (Pro-Hull Beam) Use the Beam to repair their engines.

event.text: The Pro-Hull Beam works perfectly, sealing up the breach. It doesn't take long before you can hardly make out the area of damage.
"Here, have this as thanks. We were going to sell this to buy more fuel anyways."

choice.text: (Repair-Bot Dispersal) Release the nanobots to repair their engines.

event.text: The nanobots make quick work, sealing up the breach. It doesn't take long before you can hardly make out the area of damage.
"Here, have this as thanks. We were going to sell this to buy more fuel anyways."
"So, you're just going to leave us here?" The Federation captain calms himself before speaking again. "Ok. I understand. Best of luck with your mission, captain." He ends the transmission.

event.name: DISTRESS_DUSK_ABOUT_DUSK
event.text: A Duskbringer ship is the source of this distress beacon, but they don't seem to be in any peril. "Perfect. A Renegade. I have a question for you. What do you think of the name... Duskbringer? What does it mean to you?"
"That's pretty cool, I guess. And, why would you say that it reminds you of... that?"
"Oh, it does? You have a way with words, Renegade." The Duskbringer gives you some scrap for your attempt to explain yourself.

choice.text: What kind of dreary creep wants things to get darker?

event.text: "Cool it with the name-calling. That's kind of an unsatisfying explanation, but whatever." The Duskbringer carelessly tosses out a handful of resources at you, as if to punctuate their annoyance.
"Harsh... but maybe not entirely unaccurate. Would you care to explain why you feel that way?"

choice.text: It's kind of a lame way to say you're bringing darkness to your enemies.

event.text: "So that's what it means? We're the heralds of darkness? That's good enough for me." The Duskbringer gives you some resources for answering. "And, you're just mad because you're jealous."

choice.text: Zoltans are always pretentious, you guys are just weird about it.

event.text: "Screw you, jerk. You come to our region and start insulting us for asking a simple question?" The ship powers its weapons and attacks you.

"I have no concept of this... Scream-o you speak of. What kind of music is it?" You send them an audio file of a (relatively) popular scream-o song. "Woah... this truly speaks to me! I did not think humans were capable of such sounds. That doesn't answer my question or anything, but I will leave it be for now. I have some research to do." The grateful Duskbringer gives you a gift for your time.

choice.text: I just think of you as dumb exploding jerks.

event.text: "Well now you're just being nasty. You know what? I don't need this right now. Eat energized death, cretin." The ship powers its weapons and attacks you.

choice.text: I genuinely never thought about it.

event.text: "I think about it all the time. What exactly is... 'dusk'? What does it even mean? How should I feel about it?"

choice.text: Explain the cultural nuances of the word.

event.text: "So it's the end of a period of time where it goes from dim to dark? But wouldn't it just go from light to dark instantly?" You explain further about how on planets, the sunset typically happens through an atmosphere, making the process more gradual than simply obscuring the sun. "I guess I should go onto the surface of a planet one of these days. I've never been. You've been helpful, so I guess I can give you some kind of reward."

The Duskbringer ogles the timelapses you have sent for what seems like several minutes. "Wow! This is amazing. If this is what we're bringing, we're doing something right, apparently. Here's your reward, friend."
"Whatever. Then I'll ask somebody else."

event.name: QUEST_DUSK_HIJACK
event.text: A Zoltan engineer is orbiting the nearby moon, their captain pacing back and forth in a worried fashion. When you appear, they immediately hail you. "Good, maybe you can help! The Duskbringers have hijacked an Auto-ship I was working on and if I don't get it back soon, they'll likely extract any data we have stored on those data drives. If you could get it back, I'll give you a copy of whatever sector scans it has retrieved."
"Excellent! Thank you so much, it'd be disastrous for the Duskbringers to get their hands on that intel."

choice.text: Ignore the offer and attack the ship!

event.text: You have no need for sector scans, but you could make use of the scrap from this guy's ship!
You have no need for the sector scans and turn down the offer.

event.name: QUEST_DUSK_HIJACK_AUTO

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Ministry Auto-ship was hijacked by the Duskbringers. Recover it here.

event.text: A small Duskbringer research outpost has been constructed nearby, with the Auto-ship in question docked outside. With your intuition as a Renegade (and using basic common sense), you figure it's obvious there's limited ways out of this without confrontation.
Fortunately, the platform the Auto is docked with is far away enough - this fight shouldn't risk damaging it. Just focus all your fire on the Duskbringers!
Maybe this isn't worth it after all. The engineers will have to find someone else to get their Auto back from.

event.name: DUSK_HIJACK_WIN
event.text: "Perfect! You got her back in one piece too! Maybe the Ministry was too hasty in expressing their reservations over Renegades. Your sector maps, as promised."

event.name: QUEST_DUSK_PISSED
event.text: A small fleet of Duskbringer ships has blockaded this beacon. You attempt to sneak past but a squadron of Duskbringer ships fly down to stop you. You assume a fight is imminent, but instead you receive a hail. "A Federation ship? It's unorthodox, but I have a favor to ask of you..."

You are greeted into a large meeting room furnished very strangely. Antique maps and weaponry line the walls, and a Duskbringer Martyr sits on a leather armchair sipping from a cup of tea. "Yes, hello. I know our political alignments have made us enemies, but today I think we can reach a mutually beneficial agreement. As you have surely noticed, the interlopers from Universe 1 are quite the issue for us since Wentworth-1 ordered them to betray our pact. Now, my men and I have been assigned to keeping this... filth out of our sector. There is a particularly slippery and obnoxious Rebel commander being supplied by an unknown force around these parts who has been giving me trouble. Give me your service and kill him, and I will give you mine in return. Is this a fair deal?"
"Most excellent. Here are the co-ordinates of this nitwitted loon. I believe he goes by the title... ahem... Commander 'Kick your Ass' Kyle. Ugh, how distasteful..."
"A pity. Alright men, you know how to handle this one." The Duskbringer soldiers grab their weapons and chase you off the ship. An elite vessel is dispatched to destroy you.

event.name: DUSK_PISSED_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Commander 'Kick your Ass' Kyle is sowing chaos for the Duskbringers.

event.text: You've arrived at the destination specified by the Duskbringers. Indeed, a massive Rebel ship is attacking a small Zoltan settlement, of which you aren't even sure belongs to the Duskbringers.

"NOW WHO MIGHT THIS BE?! DO YOU KNOW WHO I AM? I AM KICK YOUR ASS KYLE, AND I BET YOU CAN GUESS WHAT I'M GOING TO DO TO YOU!" He pauses for a moment. "IN CASE YOU'RE STUPID, I'LL EXPLAIN IT. I'M GOING TO KICK-" You mute him while you decide what to do.
You briefly unmute Kyle, but after a long string of explicit insults you mute him for the remainder of the fight and prepare to attack.

choice.text: He doesn't deserve our time. Leave him for the Dusks to handle.

event.text: You switch the engines into reverse and fly away from the Rebel ship. Why is it you who always gets the weird jobs?

"NOW WHO MIGHT THIS BE?! WHY, IT CAN'T BE! YOU'RE THAT LITTLE SHIT THAT KEEPS BLOWING UP MY SISTER! DO YOU KNOW WHO I AM? I AM KICK YOUR ASS KYLE, AND I BET YOU CAN GUESS WHAT I'M GOING TO DO TO YOU!" He pauses for a moment. "IN CASE YOU'RE STUPID, I'LL EXPLAIN IT. I'M GOING TO KICK-" You mute him while you decide what to do.
You briefly unmute Kyle, but after a long string of explicit insults you mute him for the remainder of the fight and prepare to attack.

choice.text: He doesn't deserve our time. Leave him for the Dusks to handle.

event.text: You switch the engines into reverse and fly away from the Rebel ship. Why is it you who always gets the weird jobs?

event.name: DUSK_PISSED_DEFEAT
event.text: "NO! THIS CAN'T BE! MY ASS... has been... kicked... Dad's going to be so pissed." The Rebel ship has been neutralized. You scrap the remains of what was once Kyle's ship.

While scrapping the Rebel ship, you notice a small pod eject from the vessel. Due to being on a different comm system, you have not yet muted it. Kyle appears on the screen, his oversized melon of a face red and sweaty. "YOU HAVEN'T HEARD THE LAST OF ME, YOU FEDERATION DIPSH-" Kyle doesn't get to finish this last insult before a Duskbringer carrier jumps into the system and annihilates the pod in a single shot.

You receive a hail from the same Duskbringer as before. "Very good. It is most unfortunate I did not arrive earlier to partake in the fight, but I see you did sufficient work, and now this neanderthal is dead. You upheld your job... for the most part... and so I shall uphold mine."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_DUSKBRINGER
textList.text: The Duskbringers are more extreme than the regular Zoltans, if that was even possible. Usually, they prefer to kill on sight, and the ship here attempts to do the same.
Duskbringers blame the Federation in particular for the Rebellion's uprising. There is already a Duskbringer ship here, and they intend to repay the favor.
There are many ways to describe the Duskbringers. One such way might be overly agressive space nazis, but you don't have time to fathom more before a ship is attacking!
A Duskbringer ship is approaching at high speeds. Arm the weapons!
Duskbringer patrols often scout out the sector to ward off unwanted visitors. One of these patrols has spotted you and moves in to attack.

"Greedy, corrupt Renegade pig! Your presence here violates code protocol-R78-T! Prepare to be erased!" You suspect their fury is due to more than a simple protocol violation, but you have no choice but to fight.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_DUSKBRINGER_STATION
textList.text: "Unidentified ship, this system is off-limits for- ah crap, Feds!" The nearby Duskbringer station activates their arsenal, ready to attack.
The Duskbringers are surprisingly even more cautious of protecting their borders than the Zoltans. A station built here to ward off ships like yours spots you, and a fight is inevitable.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_DUSKBRINGER
textList.text: A smug Rebel captain hails you. "Do you need further proof that your Federation is corrupt, when your existence doesn't fuel just one, but two Rebellions?"

The Rebels and Duskbringers have a strange relationship. Though it would be a lie to say they like each other, the two have a weak bond over their hatred of the Federation. The Rebel ship at this beacon wastes no time proving that this hatred has yet to die down.
Though this is not their territory, Rebel forces are not all too uncommon in Duskbringer sectors. It appears you have encountered one of their ships.
"Blegh, can't say I'm a fan of these Zoltan idiots either. Buncha' mini space-nazis or something. Anyways, time to die!"

You're hailed by the Rebel ship at this beacon. "Well, aren't you just so brave, coming here? I wondered if I would see you here, considering how much you love killing your enemies. Funny, because I just happen to love doing the exact same thing!"

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_PIRATE_DUSKBRINGER
textList.text: A pirate hiding from the Duskbringers already occupies this beacon. They seem confident in taking on your ship, and attack!

You pick up a frequency between two pirate ships. "Yeah, these damn Zoltan bastards -- no, everything is still going as planned -- ah crap, Federation!" It appears they've noticed you. One of the ships escapes, but the other attacks!

Despite trying desperately to keep pirate forces at bay, there's a considerable amount of underground black markets and slave trades held in Duskbringer sectors. Why the pirates do this, whether to rub their superiority in the Zoltans' faces or some other ulterior motive doesn't matter, because one such ship is barreling down on you!
"A Fed? In this sector? How curious. You should have stayed away, amigo. You might think the Dusks are the biggest threat here, but you're wrong. We pirates own this sector!"
"Damn it, Federation too? Why can't we just catch a break!" The pirates at this beacon don't seem pleased at your presence. Prepare for battle.

event.name: DUSK_ROCK_FANATICS
event.text: The Rockmen have always had a fascination with Zoltan culture, so it's not too far of a stretch for some to align with Duskbringer views. The Rock ship here clearly takes its devotion to the Duskbringer cause seriously, and is eager to take you down.

event.name: DUSK_PIRATE_CAPTURE
event.text: Two ships inhabit this beacon, a Duskbringer and a Pirate. You notice something isn't right, the two aren't attacking. You then realize that the Duskbringer ship is empty, and the original crew is aboard the pirate ship. You catch their chatter on the comms. "Damn it! - Federation ship, no time to get back - we'll have to fight them from in here!"

event.name: DUSK_ZOLTAN_UNSURE
event.text: You are hailed by a Zoltan ship. Their captain speaks in an unsure tone: "Federation... You have caused this war to escalate far further than you ever expected. It no longer affects just you, but the other races of the galaxy as well. We request that you suggest a way to quell the Duskbringers' anger."

choice.text: Give them your flight plans, knowing it will most likely end up in Rebel hands.

event.text: The Duskbringers and Rebels have been known to share information about the Federation with each other, and you suspect this will only speed up the fleet. Still, you hand the information over to the Zoltan ship, who seems satisfied.

choice.text: Donate some scrap to help the Zoltans.

event.text: Parting with your precious scrap is not easy, but you know it will help the Zoltans at the very least to a small extent.

choice.text: (Ministry Crew) Preach to the Zoltans and convince them you know the ways of peace.

event.text: Your Zoltan launches into a long, incredibly boring lecture about nonviolence and pacifist ideals. Though it almost puts you into a coma from boredom, it appears to have emotionally moved the crew of the other Zoltan ship. Thoroughly convinced you are different from the other militarized Federation ships, they let you pass.

choice.text: Dealing with the Dusks is not our problem.

event.text: "I was suspecting you might say that. I'm afraid we cannot simply let you continue to destroy our ways of life by growing the divide in our government even wider."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_DUSKBRINGER_CAPITOL
textList.text: The Rebel invasion of this sector is bad news for not just the Duskbringers, but you as well. A Rebel forward scout locks onto your location and attacks.
"Well, ain't this a nice turn of events. I expected to be stuck fighting Zoltans this entire invasion, but now a Fed shows up? My lucky day!"
A Rebel thirsting for blood is a threat you'd like to avoid, but unfortunately this encounter hasn't given you an option. A hostile Rebel ship approaches!
A smug Rebel captain hails you. "Do you need further proof that your Federation is corrupt, when your existence doesn't fuel just one, but two Rebellions?"
"Blegh, can't say I'm a fan of these Zoltan idiots either. Buncha' mini space-nazis or something. Anyways, time to die!"

You're hailed by the Rebel ship at this beacon. "Well, aren't you just so brave, coming here? I wondered if I would see you here, considering how much you love killing your enemies. Funny, because I just happen to love doing the exact same thing!"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_DUSKBRINGER_ELITE
event.text: The New Order contains only the most devoted members of the Duskbringer organization. Nothing will stop them from bringing down the Federation, not even death. A New Order ship swoops in, guns blazing and ready to destroy you. Looks like you'll have to do the same.

event.name: DUSK_CLONECANNON
event.text: You've seen a lot of strange sights in your journeys as a Multiverse Renegade, but you don't think you've ever seen a gun like the one strapped to the nearby Auto-ship. At the back is what looks to be a... Clone Bay?

choice.text: Approach the ship and attempt to dismount the weapon.

event.text: You approach the ship only for it to activate, and the weapon powers on. A Duskbringer, clad in their usual armor, peeks out from the gun before hurtling harmlessly past your ship and exploding into the vacuum of space. A few seconds later, and the same Zoltan pops out of the gun again. Weird...
Tempting as it is, there's no way you could retrieve anything from the Auto-ship without alerting it. You leave the ship behind.

event.name: DUSK_CLONECANNON_ESCAPING
event.text: The Auto-ship's engines activate, and the ship flicks into reverse. They're trying to get away!

event.name: DUSK_CLONECANNON_GOTAWAY
event.text: The bizarre ship jumps away, leaving you behind at the beacon.

event.name: DUSK_CLONECANNON_DEFEAT
event.text: The automated vessel explodes, sending debris scattering for you to collect.

To your surprise, the strange weapon from the wreckage has survived. You bring it aboard only to find the Duskbringer aboard still alive, perpetually cloned by the machine. He remembers little about his life because of the constant cloning, so he identifies himself simply as "projectile". He has nothing left but this gun, and so he asks that, should you keep him around, you continue to use him as his name suggests.

choice.text: Leave the weapon free for someone else to occupy.

event.name: NEBULA_ANURAK
event.text: Unfortunately, you've dove right into the center of a particularly thick ion storm. You catch sight of what seems to be two separate ships slipping through the nebula, but before you can even initiate contact, you receive a mysterious hail from another ship which quickly disappears into the clouds, advising you to follow them.

You take your mind off the other vessels for a moment and tail the ship that hailed you, which eventually leads you to a smaller rogue planet. You don't catch sight of the vessel until you finally land and realize it's just a small shuttle. Next to it awaits an Orchid covered in typical Illesctrian robes who beckons for you to follow. "We understand you are a Renegade, correct? Come, please. The master awaits you, and there is much he must share."

Hoping your questions will be answered soon, you follow the Orchid to a large tank-like vessel. According to your database, this is a repurposed Duskbringer army truck, originally designed to carry up to 20 soldiers for rapid ground deployment. Now, it seems its weapon arrays have been replaced with basic utilities like a clothes line and a small battery powered terrarium. The Orchid bows and points to the door, suggesting you enter.

You attempt to follow what seemed to be Rebels for almost an hour but never catch sight of them again. Disappointed and frustrated, you decide to leave before the Rebel fleet has a chance to make any major gains on you.
Not quite enticed by either mystery, you decide the best course of action is to leave.

event.name: ANURAK_SOUP_OFFER
event.text:
As soon as you enter you're met with a strange smell, a mixture of spices and incense, which makes a couple of your crew gag. The rattle of pots and other trinkets can be heard from the adjacent room, which reveals a Zoltan in a long decorated robe stirring some strange concoction - maybe soup, though with the smell it's hard to tell - with a big metal pot. "Oh- oh! Friends! I do hope you're friends!"
The Zoltan hobbles towards you, limping from a glitch in his damaged chassis. As he approaches you, he puts his hand on your face, and begins feeling around your features as if uncertain if you're real. "Huh. Renegades. I know it from the look in your eye. Don't deny it! I am a man - I think a man. What is a man? That's a question for later, hmph - of peace! That is what we call it, I think. But still, I can respect it! The world needs killers... erm... maybe that's an indictment on the world. Wish we didn't. But we do! And that's your job. It's cool. Would you like some soup?!"
You're put off guard by the sudden subject change, but figure if you want to understand what this is about, you should say yes.

"Anurak! Where did you go? You disappeared... then Hektar swept in nearly unopposed! For the sake of Guntput tribe, Guntput demand answers!"
The Zoltan sighs. "I am sorry, Guntput. Please, sit down. I will tell you all about it over soup."
Guntput takes a seat, and you're pulled into doing so as well.
"Yes, that's one soup for my lizard friend, one soup for... what did you say your name was again?" You begin to answer him but he cuts you off. "Oh, yes yes that's right. Your name is... Shells...ken..bry... Yes! You're Shellskenbry, aren't you? Yes, that definitely seems to be your name." He continues to deal out the soup to every person in your crew, getting their names wrong as well.
"A friend of Guntput is a friend of mine..." He notices Guntput's eye staring him down expectantly. "Oh, yes that's right. I'll tell my tale, then. A-hem. You see, it all starts with my childhood..." Anurak begins to prattle on about every little thing that led him to his current circumstances, although his manner of explanation ends up raising more questions as he frequently gets distracted from his points to half-clarify little details that hardly matter. You zone in and out of his long winded explanation, but you manage to catch the last bit. "...It was something of a catch-22. I could not stay and die for you without endangering you with my death. By allegedly dying early, I spared you that torment. And aside from that, I have other responsibilities that are catching up for me from my days as a Duskbringer."
"For holy man, you speak like scatterminded weasel. But... Guntput know now why you left, so Guntput forgive. All ended better than could have."
A lizard slithers out of a secret compartment and scoops up a bowl of soup. The lizard and Guntput meet each other's gaze, before the lizard goes back into its compartment.

choice.text: What was that you were saying about being a Duskbringer?

event.text:
"Yes indeed! I was a Duskbringer, it's true. Big mistake, but those were different times! We were all so angry at the Ministry, the Federation, and the sweet promises of a glorious future were so alluring! But bah, there was nothing glorious. Maybe glorious. Define glorious? No, scratch that. It wasn't glorious at all! Would you like more soup?!"
Without waiting for you to answer, Anurak pushes his chair aside and stumbles over back to the soup pot, fetching another bowl and throwing it down before you, sloshing some of it on you, though Anurak doesn't seem to notice. "By the Eye, I love soup! Best liquid you can consume. That's a lie. No it's not.
Now, I've made many mistakes in my life, and I'm not proud of them. Personally, I'd like to stay here and hide from them. Unfortunately, my friend Devorak wouldn't. Maybe you've heard of him, maybe you haven't. He's an old veteran of the Fed-Mantis War, and a Duskbringer Warhero. It's funny though, he's not much of a Duskbringer. Seems his mistakes, in the eyes of our 'glorious' leaders - they're not so glorious - is his faltering dedication to the movement. Now he's gotten us BOTH into a pickle! Hahah, heheh... oh boy..."

The Zoltan claps his hands together and rambles about soup for a while as he grabs a ladle from the shelf and stirs his big pot. He rings a bell and several more robed individuals enter the room - a mix of species, but mostly Zoltans and Orchids, who each help themselves to a bowl of soup. As the Zoltan is serving them, you also notice a secret compartment that's opened, and a lizard-like creature comes out, scoops up a bowl of soup, and vanishes without being spotted by anyone else.
Once you've all received your soup, the Zoltan beckons for you to sit with him and begins to messily gulp down his entire bowl in a few seconds. "Now that you've so handily accepted my soup, I think we are friends indeed! Oh how lovely, I love meeting new friends. I! - I am Anurak. That is my name, whatever a name might be to you. And you are... no wait, don't tell me. Uhm... hmmm." Anurak contemplates your face for several moments, never making direct eye contact. "You look like a... Shells...ken..bry... Shellskenbry! Yes, that is your name! Most definitely. Hello Shellskenbry!"
Anurak leans over the table, knocking over his soup bowl and reaching out his hand and shaking yours. "Glad to meet you!"

Anurak ignores you, instead shifting slightly as the Orchid from earlier brings over a rag and helps wipe up the spilled soup. "Well Shellskenbry, you're probably very curious what's going on! I can answer any question! Well, not any question. Some questions. I actually am in dire need of your help, you see! Long ago, I was a Duskbringer. Big mistake, but those were different times! We were all so angry at the Ministry, the Federation, and the sweet promises of a glorious future were so alluring! But bah, there was nothing glorious. Maybe glorious. Define glorious? No, scratch that. It wasn't glorious at all! Would you like more soup?!"
Without waiting for you to answer, Anurak pushes his chair aside and stumbles over back to the soup pot, fetching another bowl and throwing it down before you, sloshing some of it on you, though Anurak doesn't seem to notice. "By the Eye, I love soup! Best liquid you can consume. That's a lie. No it's not.
Now, I've made many mistakes in my life, and I'm not proud of them. Personally, I'd like to stay here and hide from them. Unfortunately, my friend Devorak wouldn't. Maybe you've heard of him, maybe you haven't. He's an old veteran of the Fed-Mantis War, and a Duskbringer Warhero. It's funny though, he's not much of a Duskbringer. Seems his mistakes, in the eyes of our 'glorious' leaders - they're not so glorious - is his faltering dedication to the movement. Now he's gotten us BOTH into a pickle! Hahah, heheh... oh boy..."

The Monk frowns but just nods his head and limps towards the soup pot. "No soup, no soup. It's always no soup with you. Fine, go, shoo." He rambles on for a while and you decide it's not worth trying to negotiate with him anymore.

event.name: ANURAK_EXPLAIN_2
event.text:
"Well you see, Devorak and I had worked together in the past, and he came to me one day with an absolutely insane idea! He wanted to LEAVE the Duskbringers! N-no one does that! At least, if they do, they don't live to see the next cycle! I told him he was crazy, but the Duskbringers have seemingly grouped me into this whole thing. I've found my faith, and frankly I'm good where I am. I was hiding out in the Ministry for a while, but had to fake my death when an assassin came for me. Now I'm hiding here, but naturally, they're STILL after me! The only way to clear this up, me thinks, is to find Devorak and get him to clear my name of any involvement with him.
That's where you come in! Yes, you, Shellskenbry! I have taken the oath of nonviolence, and cannot travel to Devorak without risking my life. If you could be so kind as to take me there, I'm sure I can convince him to reward you ever so kindly! And I'll make you soup! So, what do you say?"

Anurak pats you on the back and thanks you eagerly, bowing a couple times and calling for a third round of soup. You're about to suggest heading out quickly when there's a loud series of bangs outside.
Scattered gunfire and the thunderous noise of a ship entering the atmosphere break the previously silent atmosphere of the planet. You rush outside to survey what's happening and spot a Duskbringer elite approaching. Anurak panicks, "They're here! The caravan can't protect itself! Please, help us, or we'll all be executed! And then who will be there to make soup for the poor and hungry?!"
The strange Monk might talk a lot - but the other inhabitants of the caravan might be put in danger if the Duskbringers get to Anurak. You get ready for combat.

choice.text: We aren't getting involved in this.

event.text: "Y-you won't help? Shellskenbry, I trusted you! In the 10 minutes we've known each other I thought we were becoming friends! Oh no... oh no..."

event.name: ANURAK_WIN
event.text: The Duskbringer ship has been felled, and it leaves a sizeable crater on the planet's surface below. You swoop in to salvage the remains before contacting Anurak again.

Upon your return Anurak claps for you, looking around him and raising his hands to convince the other monks to clap as well. "Oh bravo! You've done it! But... they already found me out here! Oh this is bad! Wait... am I overreacting? Damn it, stop overreacting! No, no I'm not. It is bad! Oh what to do, what to do... Uh uh... my ship! I buried it somewhere here. Take it, just take it Shellskenbry! M-maybe they're tracking it? I need to get rid of everything I have that's tied to the Duskbringers!"

choice.text: You had a plan and we'll follow through. We'll protect you until we find Devorak.

event.text: "Oh Shellskenbry! You're right, how could I forget! The plan! Well, it's not much of a plan. Or is it? I suppose it is, yes... right, okay. Let's get going then! I'll transfer the coordinates of the hideout Devorak's been at. Let's make haste and waste no time!"
"Oh, did I annoy you that much? Darn... well I can't ask much more, but I thought we were friends, Shellskenbry! Oh, the misery!"

event.name: DEVORAK_HIDEOUT
event.text: You've tracked down the hideout coordinates Anurak gave you, an old Ministry research outpost that was abandoned during the onset of the Duskbringer revolution. However, there seems to be little activity both outside and within. Bioscans show only one individual inside, though they don't seem to be a Zoltan. Something is wrong here.

You land on the landing pad nearby and pull open the rusty doors, noticing scattered Duskbringer armor all over the floor. While there's obviously no corpses, the faint residual energy signatures suggest all of these soldiers died here. Chances are, you're about to find the killer.
Deeper into the hideout you eventually find a main lobby, surprisingly cosy for a once science outpost and now ex-terrorist hideout, with a man in grey armor sprawled on a couch with his arm dangling off, waiting for you. "Good, good. You made it. Was wondering how long until you'd get here, after I spied your ship near that Monk's hideout. Idiotic green freaks couldn't contain their temper even when I told them to wait, and look where it got them! Blown to smithereenes." The man gets off the couch, revealing himself to be of an impressive height. He peels off his painted MFK helmet and places it on the table and reaches out his hand. "I, on the other hand, am not so stupid as to tangle with Renegades. The name's Sagittarius. Well, not really. The name's Jack. But Vael calls me Sagittarius, one of his goofy lil' nicknames." He flashes a smile and extends his hand even further across the table, demanding you shake it.

event.name: DEVORAK_HIDEOUT_ANGEL
event.text:
Right as you go to grab his hand, he slides it back smoothly and throws up to finger guns. "Oh, too slow! Hahah! Get's 'em every time." The mercenary spins around and flops back onto the couch. "So, with the pleasantries out of the way, shall we begin? I think we shall! If you're observant and knowledgeable - no offense if you aren't! - you'll likely have noticed I am an Angel. One of the Syndicate's goons, minion for Vael, bla bla bla. I'm a Mercenary, a good one. I get things done. I know Renegades and Mercenaries have some bad blood but we're both in the business of efficiency. And I think I've found a way for us both to be very efficient together. It's a bit of a reprisal of a less glamorous plan I had before, but I think we can weave you in and make something that REALLY blows all the socks off!"
The man draws a cigarette from his pocket and lights it with a flame he produces from a miniature flamethrower built into his sleeve. "Since you've met the Monk I'm sure you've at least been introduced to the name Devorak. I'm not quite sure how Zoltans do 'physical attraction' but apparently I've heard he's quite strapping. The darling of not only the Duskbringers but the Ministry too! Indeed, Mr. Rei exists in a grey zone between 'patriot' and 'rebel' to the aspiring youth of the Ministry. Everyone's grown tired of the corrupt faculties of Minister Lumei, and day by day more and more turn to radical venues like the Duskbringers."

Jack puts a finger to his lips and shushes you. "Shhh, patience Renegade! Don't you care about backstory and context? Where's the fun in this line of work if you don't set the scene first!" The Angel clears his throat. "Now, where was it? Oh yes. You see, Devorak has become the poster child of the entire Duskbringer movement!
