His face alone has convinced countless Zoltans to betray the Ministry. He's seen as a moderate amongst all of these 'terrorists'. Someone reasonable and rational, turned against only the corrupt Ministry officials who caused all of this mess. But that's just what THEY say at least. I don't really care if he's the nicest guy in the Multiverse or a raving psychopath. He's my target, so no matter what kind of person he is, he's about to end up dead."
Jack pauses, letting this sink in before continuing. "But you see, this is no ordinary hit. For the very people that hired me are the Duskbringers themselves! There's a lot of fear that Devorak may have turned again, and that he's planning to renounce his membership. At such a pivotal moment in the Duskbringer movement... well it'd be quite disastrous, yeah? This whole Universe 1 backstab though? Very, very advantageous. Say... a Rebel killed Devorak before he ever had the chance to denounce the Duskbringers, yeah?" Jack snaps his fingers at you and nods. "That would be VERY advantageous indeed. It'd be the Rebels crossing one final line, and the Ministry isn't going to do anything of course. It's just enough to convince some gullible youth they need to do their part in avenging the fallen hero. Now given enough time surely it'd happen naturally, but time isn't on my clients' side."

choice.text: So let me guess, you're going to frame Devorak's assassination on the Rebels.

event.text: "Rightamundo! The Duskbringers I was traveling with were supposed to set the trap. Lure Devorak out, just in time for us to swoop in and... pew pew! We didn't expect any risk going after the Monk, with the whole non-violent schtick. But turns out, you were there. And now the lure is dead. So, frankly, I think you're sort of in my debt in a way. You ruined the plan, and now you owe it to me to fix it, yeah? It's a win win win! You get rid of a war criminal, the Dusks get their silly war and propaganda fuel, and I get Vael to stop riding my ass. How could you refuse?! You'll need that Monk though for this to work. Someone close enough to Devorak that'll actually draw him out. He still with you?"

You turn to Anurak, who's also been listening to the whole conversation. He chuckles nervously to a joke no one else heard, and looks at Jack. "Good, so he's still here. Means this plan might still work!" Jack moves closer to Anurak. "Look, I know it might be hard to turn in your friend, yeah? But think about what you'll gain from it! You want out from this Duskbringer business, right? Well the only reason you're in hot water is because the Dusks think you're with Devorak. Do this for me, and you'll also absolve yourself of any threat you might pose to the Duskbringers. You'll be a free man! See? Everyone wins here! How could you refuse this offer?"

event.name: DEVORAK_HIDEOUT_ANGEL_ACCEPT
event.text: Jack pats you on the back, throwing you into a half-embrace as if you've known each other your whole life. "Good! See, that's what I like about Renegades. You understand the benefits of paying off a debt. In this business, it always helps to have friends in high places, right? Well, I won't waste any more of your time. I'll patch over the coordinates and we'll be on our way." Jack throws you a thumbs up and begins to leave. Before he steps out the door, he looks back over his shoulder and gives one last warning. "Oh but, just so we're clear Renegade. You're there to lure Devorak out so we can kill him. If you try any funny business with me, my boot crushing your throat will be the last sensation you ever feel."

event.name: DEVORAK_HIDEOUT_ANGEL_DECLINE
event.text: Jack's smile quickly disappears, replaced by a sinister glare. "Mhm. Right, that's just the thing with you Renegades isn't it? You contribute nothing to society unless you can see a way to squeeze as much money out of it as possible. No interest in paying off debts you so dearly owe. Fine, if I had my choice I'd just kill you, but for as much as Vael hates you in particular, it'd just be unnecessary collateral damage. But stay out of my way."

choice.text: (Irwin) Irwin seems to be barely holding something back.

event.text:
You look over at Irwin, who's currently swaying uneasily and gripping his blunderbuss so tightly his tentacles have turned white. At last the floodgates break, and he points his gun right at Jack yelling, "Syndicate bassstardsss! Alwaysss ssscheming, alwaysss plotting the next disssassster! I'm on to you! I know your sssecretsss! Your plansss! I don't trusssst you for one moment! You're up to sssomething more, I jussst know it!"
Jack laughs gently, genuinely humored by this outburst. "Well if it isn't the weasel that gave Virgo the slip! Good going, really. That man was of no worth to the Syndicate anyways. Hence why he got stuck handling you, of course. Why the outrage anyways, Irwin? Still stuck in your little conspiracy land? Guess what. Everyone's conspiring to rule the Multiverse. It's not a secret, it's very well known and well documented."
Jack looks back at you. "Now that the interruption is out of the way, let's hear your response captain. What will it be?"

Jack hangs his head in disappointment. "Of course, I should have known you'd be too reckless to keep him around. You Renegades never fail to disappoint me, you know. So unreliable, can never be counted upon to pay off a debt. Fine then. I'm sure the Syndicate will have other uses for you in the future. Keep an ear out, because Vael doesn't like to keep dirty debtors around for long."

The man stands there, smiling, his hand still outreached. Despite the situation you can't help but feel you're the one being awkward, not him. A few solid minutes go by and you realize he isn't going to keep talking until you've shaken his hand. Might as well stow your pride and just go with it.
This seems highly suspicious. Better not to get too close. Whatever the situation is with Devorak, you'll have no further part.

event.name: DEVORAK_FINALE
event.text: For the supposed secret hideout of an ex-terrorist, you didn't quite expect a busy city planet populated to the brim with Zoltans and even some other species. This seems to be a trade hub of some sort, though the coordinates lead you to a small landing pad next to a shady looking docking port.

choice.text: Without Anurak we have no way to lure Devorak out.
Send in Anurak to find Devorak.

event.text:
You follow Anurak to the docking port, though with his strange hobbling even more haphazard than normal, you figure he's just as unsure what to do as you are. As Anurak approaches a small metal door guarded by a burly Outcast, you take a glance around you. No sighting of Jack or any Syndicate or Rebel ships around. Maybe that's for the best?
"Hello door man! Man who guards doors. As you are. Because you're standing by the door!" Anurak laughs uncomfortably and the Rockman growls. "I'm a woman."
"Oh, yes yes. Of course, I didn't intend to offend! By door man I did not intend to imply gender, only that you are a 'man who guards' doors. Man being as in 'Rockman', in its most gender neutral form! I too am of a neutral gender form, though I do not oft-" The Rockman growls again. "Shut the hell up. Unless you've got business here, you ain't welcome." She looks up at you and your crew. "Specially no Renegades."
Anurak nods. "Yes of course, right... well uh. I do believe we do have business here, yes! My friend Shellskenbry and I are here to find a man named Devorak! About yay high, light green, carries a big goofy looking orange sword. Have you seen him?"
The Rockman crosses her arms. "Never heard of him. And even if I had, I wouldn't let anyone near him unless they had a password."
"A... A password? Uhm... I don't think I know any passwords. Well, I know many passwords. But I don't know if the passwords I know are the same passwords you know. I can make you some soup! Will that get us inside?"
"No." The Rockman steps to the side, further blocking the door. You notice a few other guards, all Zoltan, hiding in the shadows watching you.

choice.text: If he was here, perhaps you could pass a message to him?

event.text:
Anurak, upon hearing your suggestion, nods. "Yes, if you could just send him a message! Uh, tell him that Anurak is here, looking for him. I need to talk about important personal business."
"And why should I do anything for you, Monk? I know your type. I used to pop the heads off of religious zealots back in-"
The Rockman is cut off by a raspy voice gleefully shouting Anurak's name. "ANURAK! You've come to me at last!" A slender Zoltan struts out from the door and pulls Anurak into a brotherly embrace. "My old friend! I heard you had died on some lizard planet!" Devorak pulls away for a second to look his old friend in the face. Anurak squirms uncomfortably in his embrace.

Devorak turns to you, as if realizing you're there for the first time. He stares at you blankly dead in the eyes, making you feel very uncomfortable. "Am I who? No, no. I am not Devorak. I am nothing but a hollow shell of light and energy. One which has died and been resurrected for an ignoble cause so many times it can no longer feel pain, nor has any connection to the realm of the living." The Zoltan reaches behind him and pulls out his glowing orange sword, and holds it out to you. "This is Devorak. This sacred blade channels the soul of the being who once was me. This is my essence, my life force. If the blade is to perish, so will I." He smiles a little too fondly at the blade, then stows it again.
"So, dear friend, what brings you here?" Anurak gulps. "Well... uhm... uh... I was uh... You know what... nevermind! Hahah... heheh..." Devorak shakes his head. "Oh come on, you can tell me! We've known each other since... what, forever? Did you change your mind? Have you come to help me? I think the Rebellion's betrayal is finally the ammunition we need to dissolve the Duskbringers, this is our chance Anurak! Our chance to stop this whole mess, to-"
Anurak finally breaks, cutting Devorak off in exasperation. "I want you to cut any involvement I have in your stupid suicidal ploy! You're going to get yourself killed and more importantly you're going to get ME killed! I don't want a part of this, I want OUT."
Devorak seems confused. "But... but Anurak, this is HOW we get out. We have to fight back, show everyone exactly why the Duskbringers can't be allowed to win. We can't just do nothing!"
Anurak keeps shaking his head, smacking himself on the cheek and spinning in circles. "No no no no no no! You didn't HEAR ME! I NEED OUT! OUT! OUT!" It looks like he's about to break down psychologically, when an explosion sends all of you tumbling!

You look up to the skyline, expecting to see a Rebel vessel as promised - but what you see is no Rebel! A Federation cruiser has descended upon the city, followed by a fleet of smaller vessels that are engaged in combat with some Duskbringers who have 'heroically' swooped in to save the day. You've been double-crossed! This wasn't a plot to spark further outrage against the Rebellion, it was a plot to justify all-out war with the Federation! "DUSKBRINGER RADICALS, SURRENDER YOUR WEAPONS AND YOUR PERSONS TO THE LAW OF THE FEDERATION AT ONCE! YOU WILL BE GIVEN THIS ONE AND SINGLE WARNING BEFORE WE ARE FORCED TO OPEN FIRE ON THE CITY DEFENSES AND TAKE THE TERRORISTS YOU OFFER REFUGE TO THROUGH FORCE."
The voice is clearly Jack's, though he's pretending to sound like a Federation official instead. Devorak is both shocked and betrayed. "You- this is why you're here! You've come to betray me! Do you even realize what this will do?! The entire Federation could collapse because of this! This city is under Ministry jurisdiction! They won't stand for this!"
Anurak's now broken down into full sobbing, chanting "What have I done what have I DONE!?" over and over.

choice.text: We have to do something! Attack the vessel!

event.text: You've screwed up badly here, but now's your chance to fix it. Unfortunately, both the Duskbringer and "Federation" forces are hostile to you in this one, so don't expect much support!

choice.text: We need to get out of here quickly!

event.text: You hurry back to the ship, dragging Anurak behind you. Devorak shouts something insulting in his native tongue but has little time to do anything more before heavy gunfire rains upon him and his other crew. You only barely manage to get out of the city in time before the full scale fighting begins.
This seems highly suspicious. Better not to get too close. Whatever the situation is with Devorak, you'll have no further part.

event.name: JACK_DEFEAT
event.text: The Syndicate mercenaries and their vessel have been defeated, or at least close to it. The Federation cruiser plunges into the landing pad rather smoothly for a crashing ship. While the fighting still continues, a few of the ships pause in realization the big threat has been taken down.

In the haze of the battle, you hadn't quite realized that several broadcasting drones had gathered around the city observing you, and some reporters are even on scene. Anurak seems to realize this too, and something comes over him. He rushes over to the wreckage and emerges several minutes later with a struggling body. It's Jack, badly injured, who Anurak flops on the ground and pulls the helmet off. He holds it high in the air before realizing he's facing the wrong direction for the cameras and turns around.
"The Syndicate! The Syndicate is behind this! Look at this helmet! I know it uh... it looks like an MFK helmet but it's not! It's not the Rebels, at least I don't think it is! It's an Angel! Not like, a heavenly angel! Like, a Syndicate Angel! He's a mercenary! For the Syndicate! Uhm... uh..." Devorak rushes besides him to help his old friend find the right words.
"For years the Duskbringers have petitioned that the Federation has grown weak and useless in its prime age, and have argued the Ministry should divorce itself from the alliance and become a new, all encompassing empire! Yet, in all of these years never once have the Duskbringers been able to truly justify their hatred to the Federation! It is true, the Federation is imperfect, and is composite of imperfect governments run by imperfect people. Yet it stands to represent one universal dream - true, galactic, or even Multiversal, peace. The Duskbringers don't want this peace, and so in their desperation they've found one final effort. Hiring mercenaries, pirate scum who make this galaxy an even more dangerous and villainous place, to stage a Federation assault on a peaceful Ministry trading port! Are these the actions of self professed heroes? People willing to die for their nation and the good of the galaxy? Or is it the work of a group of terrorists trying to seize power at the cost of perhaps the one and only hope we have left of achieving unity in this Multiverse?"

event.name: DEVORAK_SPEECH
event.text:
Devorak steps away from Jack and draws his sword, aiming it at the sky. "I, am Devorak Rei. To many of you, I am a hero. Perhaps to some, I am a radical. To me, I think I am both of those things, or perhaps even neither. I am a soldier who was turned bitter by war, and in my bitterness I let myself be betrayed by the Federation. I let the unjust actions of some few Union corporations and an underground Rebel insurrection channel, in all their efforts to bury the contributions of the Ministry to every major Federation War, take on the illusion as the actions of the entire Federation. I let myself be preyed upon by malicious, radical forces because they said they could change the galaxy and that's exactly what I wanted to hear. I wanted to believe the Duskbringers could solve all my problems. But they can't. The Duskbringers ARE the problem! As long as this Multiverse stands divided as it is, we will never be free of the Rebel plague or any other threat that might come over us. Fascism, nationalism, they're only pathways to decades of strife and death. How could a Federation that once stood so united in striking down the equally villainous Inquisitions now break apart so easily?"
Devorak swings down his sword and aims it at one of the camera drones, which have now moved in closer and begun to circle him. "To my Zoltan brethren, now is your chance to change the future. Should you call yourself a Duskbringer now, it is never too late to lay down your armor and your weapons, and abandon this terror. Should you be questioning your loyalty to the Federation or the Ministry, just think of what cause you would be giving up, just to become a mindless soldier to a group whose ideologies nearly mirror that of the so hated Rebellion! And should you still be a faithful Ministry or Federation ally, it is still your duty to ensure the everlastingness of this peace. For as long as those like the Duskbringers are at large in this galaxy, you and your peace will never truly be safe." Devorak bows, then stows his sword. Around him, many more Zoltans emerge from the shadows of the building behind you and yell various things against the Duskbringers. Even some dock workers and other civilians join in, and a few Duskbringer vessels from the fight above start to jump away.

As the cameras start to drift away to catch the scene elsewhere, Devorak turns to you. "I cannot discern what intentions you truly had, coming here today. However, if you did come to have me killed, you have shown your mind changed. What would I have learned, if I turned you away now after making a journey similar to mine?" Devorak looks behind him. "Unfortunately, I don't... really have anywhere to go now. I didn't think this far ahead. I need some place to keep this worn out corpse that carries me, so uh... do you need any help on your mission perhaps? I have a ship in storage, it means a lot to me but I don't think I can ever fly it again. You may have it now, I guess. Just don't get it blown up."
